thread.title: Emirates ‘Al Ain Reads’ attracts a record 70 exhibitors in 2015Travelandtourworld.com
thread.title_full: Emirates ‘Al Ain Reads’ attracts a record 70 exhibitors in 2015Travelandtourworld.com

author: travelandtourworld.com
title: Emirates ‘Al Ain Reads’ attracts a record 70 exhibitors in 2015Travelandtourworld.com
text:
Emirates ‘Al Ain Reads’ attracts a record 70 exhibitors in 2015 Published on : Monday, September 21, 2015
The annual Al Ain Reads has attracted a record 70 exhibitors, Abu Dhabi Tourism and Culture Authority, TCA Abu Dhabi, have revealed. The seventh edition of the annual Al Ain has also seen a 15% increase in exhibition area over last year’s edition and organisers.
The exhibition, to be held at the Al Ain Convention Centre, from Oct 4–11, is expected to attract book lovers from all over the UAE and the Sultanate of Oman. The event has now being expanded to eight days, following overwhelming demand from exhibitors and publishing houses.
Al Ain Reads 2015 will feature more than 60,000 literary, scientific, children’s and educational titles in English, Arabic and other languages. The literary flair of Emirati writers and emerging cultural issues will be discussed throughout a series of sessions in its dedicated cultural programme.
It is expected that the group of Emirati writers’ series of seminars and discussion sessions for scholars, and the informative and engaging ‘Creativity Corner’ will remain a major attraction for children, who, along with their parents, will be treated to a unique experience in the world of books, reading and creativity.
Juma Al Qubaisi, Executive Director of the National Library division at TCA Abu Dhabi ‘expects over 35,000 visitors this year who can participate in a series of evening lectures by eminent Emirati authors and innovators to highlight the cultural issues in the area.’
The expansion of the Oasis city’s book fair follows a successful Al Ain Reads 2014, which attracted 67 local publishers displaying over 55,000 Arabic and English literary and scientific works.
